title: Grade 7
subject: Essential Elements for English Language Arts (2024-)

document.title: Iowa Academic Standards Essential Elements for English Languange Arts

46B51DF54E7C4A9EB0C0E20441AAD44A.description:
Use general academic and domain- specific
words and phrases across contexts.

2F365F11619540C1B910CE13292C4A32.description:
Demonstrate understanding of synonyms and
antonyms.

E98E7FCE7D68421AA0B2C658F8667BA6.description:
Identify the literal and nonliteral meanings of words
in context.

D8384A1608F047E0AA0DA575EC3E24E7.description:
Demonstrate understanding of word relationships
and use.

EED59BBC0D474A438E200F270B791EEA.description:
Seek clarification and meaning support when
unfamiliar words are encountered while reading or
communicating.

B9BA6F8776B348D1A901FB01FF5EA179.description:
Use frequently occurring root words (e.g., like) and
the words that result when affixes are added (e.g.,
liked, disliked, liking).

FA5852B24A1D47E88EF9FFBC18FB0D35.description:
Use context to determine which word is missing
from a text.

BB6862D5F05E46128BD6FC0CDF4DD84C.description:
Choose language that expresses ideas precisely
and concisely, recognizing and eliminating
wordiness and redundancy

F2321E0FECC1425F974FB6E4325B75FC.description:
Use language to achieve desired outcomes when
communicating.

FE5CF233C47545F1B74C556816A62AF6.description: Spell correctly, consulting references as needed

A20152D41C034D60824114695FCD2E3B.description:
Use a comma to separate coordinate adjectives
(e.g., It was a fascinating, enjoyable movie but not
He wore an old[,] green shirt).

863C1BCC04FF4A1D8126A8D1BBEF251B.description:
Demonstrate understanding of conventions of
standard English.

1DC8B43714E2492E89CB1DD57D1B1B01.description:
Place phrases and clauses within a sentence,
recognizing and correcting misplaced and dangling
modifiers.

096CC6DF1E8F438085ACAC72824517F1.description:
Choose among simple, compound, complex, and
compound-complex sentences to signal differing
relationships among ideas.

B87AF0D147F7495D9C7D424FE3D93BE9.description:
Explain the function of phrases and clauses in
general and their function in specific sentences.

FC03527EABFA4DFC9DD9F8E6967F0E30.description:
Demonstrate standard English grammar and
usage when communicating.

09138D5CFF094EA39B62071238751CDE.description:
Communicate precisely (i.e., provide complete
information) or efficiently (i.e., telegraphic communication)
as required by the context, task, and communication
partner.

650EF87AB2514AFBA801D83BF684AEAF.description:
Select or create audio recordings and
visual/tactile displays to emphasize specific points in a
presentation.

037B2D8C248A4DC8BD56C82C50FA34B5.description:
Present findings on a topic including relevant
descriptions, facts, or details.

CCBEE699904F454B921DA511496F2ABD.description:
Determine whether the claims made by a
speaker are fact or opinion.

82B7E11B5D9442339677F561534956D5.description:
Identify details related to the main idea of a text
presented orally or through other media.

D7E31781F67F411A8A39AF7E877450C7.description:
Acknowledge new information expressed by others
in a discussion.

80E9E8DB279B4428BB4922752EB50CF0.description:
Remain on the topic of the discussion when
answering questions or making other contributions
to a discussion.

5B823323F440439EB36B8BB900399D23.description:
With guidance and support from adults and peers,
follow simple, agreed-upon rules for discussions
and carry out assigned roles.

CD205EA994FA46739DF71B896DCD87A3.description: Come to discussions prepared to share information.

6FA96C4995F54A27A9844E77D0C4CD7D.description:
Write routinely for a variety of tasks, purposes,
and audiences.

4591BE37903B4DACA5653209ACD0F39E.description:
Apply Essential Elements of Grade 7 Reading
Standards to informational texts (e.g., “Use
relevant and sufficient evidence for supporting the
claims and argument.”).

191EF9008C1A4713B7E15867056D75C8.description:
Apply Essential Elements of Grade 7 Reading
Standards to literature (e.g., “Recognize the
difference between fictional characters and
nonfictional characters.”).

EE1D5701986F4CC9B1A2D3EF4C6DA26D.description:
Use information from literary and informational
text to support writing.

D0F81674C6C545C495F64B2A781F7D42.description:
Identify quotes providing relevant information
about a topic from multiple print or digital sources.

A4FBC88EEF9541A2B9169C3D0306122B.description:
Conduct research to answer a question based on
multiple sources of information.

0C1807F2ECA34EB6ACF788ACA9D99025.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

CB22840ED0734816B59CB565DE57074A.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, to
produce writing to interact and collaborate with others.

557089270F8F422586501F60E19530E8.description:
With guidance and support from adults and
peers, plan before writing and revise own writing.

6475154023F44056A6917F4846A3EDAF.description:
Produce writing that is appropriate for the task,
purpose, or audience.

E48DBC7E1AC04346BEB032F8D5CD1DFF.description:
Use words that describe feelings of people or
characters in the narrative.

F15E483A0AE24E528CAA6FA50F063785.description:
Use temporal words (e.g., first, then, next) to signal
order.

F8809E120704433299554C8CFC3316A0.description:
Write a narrative about a real or imagined
experience introducing the experience, at least one
character, and two or more events.

8D73D4CF851F465AA3289FDD2F80B582.description: Write about events or personal experiences.

1476E3740B8343B5871C855F017B6B87.description:
Select domain-specific vocabulary to use in writing
about the topic.

4BAC35DFA48F4B86AE4A1CBEA8088D70.description:
Provide facts, details, or other information related
to the topic.

4F8E742708444BF18363999BA70DC6EE.description:
Introduce a topic and write to convey ideas and
information about it including visual, tactual, or
multimedia information as appropriate.

DE35F082EC4B4E12BCBFF981E6A2FE25.description: Write to share information supported by details.

AC2D4470F42C43E883B41C87D45EA198.description:
Use temporal words (first, next, also) to create
cohesion.

5D9B5EB6C8894EA6B8C603B2C4EFB7A1.description:
Write one or more reasons to support a claim about
a topic or text.

1EC8D373AEB54BF1A0298FB5B71AE2D9.description:
Introduce a topic or text and write one claim about
it.

94434532F8A449D99CF1A8B8A55A70A0.description: Write claims about topics or text.

883FACDB402143E98C9A83330778DB10.description:
Demonstrate understanding while actively
reading or listening to literary nonfiction.

6B5F5DA35A2247A299B6CC55A1A31B4A.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

E8B55F430EEB447FBACFA7AA4FB11CA5.description:
Compare and contrast how different texts on the
same topic present the details.

D9FD2B7C75054A389835A269FCE0ECAE.description:
Determine how a claim or reason fits into the
overall structure of an informational text.

09B180B4084E4B2B9B184D08E3C7B791.description:
Compare a text to an audio, video or multimedia
version of the same text.

3E33E6D24BBF4CCEB4EE48203B830450.description: Determine an author’s purpose or point of view.

C06366BDA1634C4B9B4838C8736367F9.description:
Determine how a fact, step, or event fit into the
overall structure of the text.

C4903B2501D94E02A2C9D28B0F220F93.description:
Determine how words or phrases are used to
persuade or inform a text.

CD5479B213CF46E4B4D9881180A75C3E.description:
Determine how two individuals, events or ideas
in a text are related.

919AA214B1D94690B8D39393F1682EDE.description: Determine two or more central ideas in a text.

982EF3E9A2B74C9FA469E476E54E611C.description:
Analyze text to identify where information is
explicitly stated and where inferences must be drawn.

4D165931A7464F02B9D77AB4662F70D9.description:
Demonstrate understanding of text while
actively engaged in reading or listening to stories, dramas,
and poetry.

99806727D769450B9FB510B1A89D1BD7.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

7888AAF4E6FD49D5BEE1BB85075EF187.description:
Compare a fictional time, place, or character in
one text with the same time, place, or character portrayed
in a historical account.

7AC87C1D6F3E448996DA7940F4DA2EF1.description:
Compare a text version of a story, drama, or
poem with an audio, video, or live version of the same text.

7E0A3C85129E4AB59EBDB7D9DA8DFA94.description:
Compare the points of view of two or more
characters or narrators in a text.

B9FBFF8B26C44E0ABE6D87292D528D11.description:
Compare the structure of two or more texts
(e.g., stories, poems, or dramas).

571CD6D49F174C3EBB79C842847F3774.description:
Determine the meaning of simple idioms and
figures of speech as they are used in a text.

D13932438739459FBCDC3A699676D85B.description:
Determine how two or more-story elements are
related.

1BB2EA07D2314964A05BB65F0B0CE278.description:
Identify events in a text that are related to the
theme or central idea.

D2F00B0B89D14E41B6F785F26CC61601.description:
Analyze text to identify where information is
explicitly stated and where inferences must be drawn.
